comments.author: AfterXII.2761
comments.body:
Wanze.8410:
StevenL.3761:
StevenL.3761:

I meant that I want to see how my offer compares to offers by other players.

I made a mockup of what I meant, in case you still don’t get it. See the attached image.

In this image, I’m selling a Bandit Trident for a little over 1 gold. I started this auction 1 week ago. Over the last 7 days, the market has moved, and the top selling offer is now below 1 gold.

This information is very relevant, even if you’re not a power trader. Right now, it’s a pain to find that information for each transaction.

As a workaround, gw2tp also shows listings and buy orders:

https://www.gw2tp.com/item/14078-hearty-bandit-trident

Hey, sorry for the delayed response. That makes alot of sense. I’ll get that in shortly.

comments.author: Wizeon.3852
comments.body:
Wanze.8410:

Your app looks interesting but for power trader use its not efficient because it only lists your last 50 listings/buy orders and I have more than that.

The bank screen thingy looks intriguing but I dont really know what info it will give you as I couldnt manage to upload a valid screenshot yet.
Might be because i only tried my guild bank and not my material storage.

What kind of info would it give me? Personally, I would like an app that lets me upload a screenshot of my bank/gbank/mat storage and it lists the different items, amounts and values.
I would see problems though for items that share the same icon, like recipes (which i have alot of).
I guess correct data could only be obtained via API, not through screen shots, but im not sure, if the new guild API for example will let get info about the items stored in the guild bank.

I dont want to get too off topic here, so I would suggest to make a new thread to introduce your app and ask for feedback.

Oh, didn’t know that it cuts off at 50 entries since I haven’t had that many while testing it. I probably should make a separate thread for it, but it’ll be on reddit, I rarely post here tbh.

The bank thing is a separate thing that’ll analyse your bank/guildbank/mat storage and tell you how much they’re worth, but it’ll only pick up the items that are available for deposit to material storage and a couple extra that people might hoard. For the reason you mentioned, no way to distinguish between different items since most of them share the icon and the pixels of the screenshot are currently one of the only ways to get information legally out of the game. API doesn’t provide any bank information, yet.

comments.author: StevenL.3761
comments.body: If you want to be safe, the formal definition of an email address specifies a maximum length of 254 characters.

comments.author: AfterXII.2761
comments.body:
chrysilis.8943:

Heya, BTW you are silently truncating email addresses to 30 characters when they are longer than that. As the field on the page accepts more characters and my email address is 31 characters long that was confusing for a second!

Thanks for letting me know. upped max length to 35 characters. Registration form will now stop you at that point as well. Let me know if you need it any higher.

comments.author: chrysilis.8943
comments.body: Heya, BTW you are silently truncating email addresses to 30 characters when they are longer than that. As the field on the page accepts more characters and my email address is 31 characters long that was confusing for a second!

comments.author: Wanze.8410
comments.body:
AfterXII.2761:

Hey guys,

I made use of the new API if any of you would like to check it out. Simply login and include your API key to see your in game transactions:

http://www.gw2shinies.com/account/login

This looks very promising, just got my first api key and checked my trading history.

As a power trader, I would like to see more filter options added, ideal would be the same filters as in the regular item search, price, name, rarity, category, etc.

Is there any easy way to import my transaction history into a spreadsheet from your website?

Would like to calculate, how much taxes and fees i paid last month.

I completed 42k buy orders within the last 90 days and 9000 sell orders.

comments.author: AfterXII.2761
comments.body:
StevenL.3761:

Very cool.

Could you add a column that displays the current best offer? Right now, you have to make a mental note of your transaction, then click the item to see the current best offer. There is no side-by-side comparison.

Well no, you would simply just swap the view to buy orders in the filters panel. Or is that not what you needed?

comments.author: StevenL.3761
comments.body:
Very cool.

Could you add a column that displays the current best offer? Right now, you have to make a mental note of your transaction, then click the item to see the current best offer. There is no side-by-side comparison.

comments.author: Zodian.6597
comments.body: I really like it. The salvage tab can be a bit misleading due to RNG. It would be really handy to have a range filter for rarity and demand/supply (units) added to this tab. Otherwise, you’re just gonna have a bunch of ppl buying exotics and salvaging them for logs and loosing net profit lol. Also as a design tip, if you added a buy/sell switch above the price columns so we could switch between the order price and instant price, that might be more intuitive. Cheers!
